p:
More than half the children hospitalized were aged <2 years, in line with other studies that found a higher risk of hospitalization in younger children
1, 15, 20 . Age was also a significant differential factor when we analysed virus subtypes. The influenza A (H1N1) pdm09 subtype was more frequent and aggressive in children aged <2 years (63.1%), while influenza B was more frequent in children aged 3â€“11 years (58.3%).
